Looks like Heritrix is doing exact matches of string that follows 
'User-agent: ' in robots.txt.  See 
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/datamodel/Robotstxt.html#38 
for where we do the parse and then here, 
http://crawler.archive.org/xref/org/archive/crawler/datamodel/RobotsExclusionPolicy.html#147, 
for the check of whats disallowed.

St.Ack


Andrea Goethals wrote:
>
> Hello,
>
> Does heritrix do any "liberal-reading" of robots.txt files when
> determining if a user agent specified in it is referring to it or does
> it take the user agent we configure for it as is?
>
> For example, if a robots.txt file says
> User-agent: bot1
>
> and we configure our user agent as:
> Mozilla/5.0 (compatible; bot1 +http://myUrl)
> will the crawler interpret the bot1 user-agent specified in the file
> as referring to it?
>
> Or do we need to specify our user agent like:
> bot1 (+http://myUrl)
>
> thanks,
> Andrea
>
